summary: This document is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor and others regarding the organization of case materials for a production, likely related to the Epstein case. It involves instructions for moving, merging, and deleting folders for various individuals, including Mark Epstein, and designating some as potential witnesses or non-witnesses.

persons.name: Matthew Osowski
persons.context: Mentioned as having a folder containing just one report, which is to be moved to another folder, and his folder is to be deleted.

persons.name: Tristen Peklo
persons.context: Mentioned similarly to Matthew Osowski; his folder is to be moved and deleted.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: A transcript of his deposition is mentioned as being in a folder; it is to be moved into a new NTW (Non-Testifying Witness?) folder for him.

events.title: Deposition of Mark Epstein
events.description: A transcript of a deposition of Mark Epstein is referenced as being among the case materials.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Location of the U.S. Attorney's Office involved in the correspondence.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: Address of the Assistant United States Attorney's office.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain about organizing case materials for a production, indicating an active legal process.
It references a deposition transcript of Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, suggesting his involvement in the case.
Instructions include merging folders for individuals deemed to be the same person and moving materials for potential testifying witnesses.
Some individuals are to be moved to a 'not-a-witness' folder, indicating a categorization process for case participants.
The correspondence involves a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor, showing government handling of case documents.
